ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course is an incredibly thorough exploration of political philosophy -- these were some of the most interesting conversations I've had in a Yale class, and I recommend it highly.
Strong survey course, delve into thinkers for 1-3 weeks, emphasis on connecting/responding to different philosophers

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of the course were class discussions, Prof. Garsten guides discussions very well, is concerned with ensuring every student gets to speak and be heard, and we develop skills in close reading. One weakness was that often we did not get to really discuss all of the readings and that was because we took a very detailed approach to close reading. While close reading is a very important skill, I would've appreciated having discussions which emphasized close reading and the pulling away and discussing the text as a whole in a broader context.

Strengths: great readings, Prof. Garsten frames conversations that elicit new discoveries, conversations that bring your thoughts outside the classroom

Weaknesses: sometimes unclear how much to connect to our contemporary lives, how much to offer your own opinion, and reconstruct philosophies (led to some wandering conversations), not strong writing feedback

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. If you are interested in political philosophy and asking questions that apply today with the context of historical writings, this is an excellent excellent class.
Yes! if you're interested in political philosophy and you haven't taken a class w Prof. Garsten
